intro: Holarrhena wulfsbergii, commonly known as the yellow flame tree, is a deciduous tree native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that bloom in clusters during the rainy season. The tree has compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces elongated, woody pods that contain flat, seed-like structures. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant floral display and ability to thrive in various soil types. The plant also has traditional uses in local medicine and as a source of timber.
